questions.question: What is the Java Collections Framework?
answers: A set of interfaces and classes to store and manipulate collections of objects
A framework for building web applications in Java
A set of tools for database management
A library for graphical user interface development

questions.question: What is the main reason to use arrays over collections in Java?
Which interface represents an ordered collection that allows duplicate entries?
Which interface in the Java Collections Framework represents a collection of unique elements?
Which interface represents a mapping between keys and values?
Which class implements the List interface and provides dynamic array functionality?
What is a key characteristic of the Set interface?
answers: It maintains the order of elements
It does not allow duplicate elements
It provides positional access to elements

questions.question: Which method is used to add an element to a collection in Java?
What is an example of a method provided by the Java Collections for searching elements?
Which implementation of the Set interface stores elements in a hash table for fast retrieval?
